org.hps.recon.particle

Class FinalStateParticleDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.recon.particle.FinalStateParticleDriver

  • public class FinalStateParticleDriver
extends Driver
    A Driver used to create unvertexed ReconstructedParticles from SVT tracks and ECal clusters. First, all track-cluster matches are found and used to create ReconstructedParticles. The remaining unmatched tracks and clusters are also made into recon particles. The collection of recon particles (FinalStateParticles) is then added to the event.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.lcsim.util.Driver

      • useTrackPositionForClusterCorrection

        private boolean useTrackPositionForClusterCorrection
        These are new for 2019 running and should be set to false in the steering file. Default values should replicate correct behavior for 2015 and 2016 data.

      • flipSign

        private int flipSign
        flipSign is a kludge... HelicalTrackFitter doesn't deal with B-fields in -ive Z correctly so we set the B-field in +iveZ and flip signs of fitted tracks Note: This should be -1 for test run configurations and +1 for prop-2014 configurations

        Parameters:

      • setUseTrackPositionForClusterCorrection

        public void setUseTrackPositionForClusterCorrection(boolean enable)
        Enable/disable the use of the track position for correcting the cluster.
        Parameters:
        enable - True to enable the correction, false otherwise.

      • setIsMC

        public void setIsMC(boolean state)
        Sets the condition of whether the data being processed is Monte Carlo. This is used to smear the cluster energy corrections so that the energy resolution is consistent with data. False by default.
        Parameters:
        state - Set to true if the data is MC, false otherwise.

      • detectorChanged

        protected final void detectorChanged(Detector detector)
        Called by the framework before the process method when the detector geometry changes. This method is gauranteed to be called once before the first call to process.
        Overrides:
        detectorChanged in class Driver
        Parameters:
        Detector - The new detector

        Called by the framework to process an event.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • makeFinalStateParticles

        private List<ReconstructedParticle> makeFinalStateParticles(EventHeader event,
                                                            List<Cluster> clusters,
                                                            List<Track> tracks)
        Create a collection of ReconstructedParticles from a list of tracks and clusters. The collection of ReconstructedParticles will include particles where a track-cluster have been matched and those that are made of just tracks or clusters.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be processed.
        clusters - The collection of ECal clusters.
        tracks - The collection of SVT tracks.
        Returns:
        A collection of ReconstructedParticles.

      • makeFinalStateParticle

        private ReconstructedParticle makeFinalStateParticle(Track track,
                                                     Cluster cluster)
        Create a ReconParticle out of a track and cluster or a track alone. If track-cluster match has been found, this method is used to create a recon particle and to set all available information about the match. This method also handles the case where a track doesn't have a matching cluster.
        Parameters:
        track - The SVT track used to build this recon particle.
        cluster - The ECal cluster used to build this recon particle.
        Returns:
        The ReconstructedParticle object.

      • makeReconstructedParticle

        private ReconstructedParticle makeReconstructedParticle(Cluster cluster)
        Make a ReconstructedParticle out of a cluster.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The ECal cluster used to make the recon particle.
        Returns:
        A ReconstructedParticle.
